page.title: 08BRADFIELD COLLEGE THEATRE
page.content: Bradfield College is an independent school catering for boys and a few girls in the 6th form.The famed feature of the school is its open air theatre.In the 1880's a chalk pit was extended and made into an imitation of the amphitheatre at Epidauros.Every three years a performance of a Greek play is put on in Greek by the boys of the College. In 1985 Sophocles' Antigone was performed.The boys were selected to take part by a series of auditions.In the first they were given a passage by Shakespeare to recite to see if they had the necessary dramatic presence. In the second the Classics Master spoke some passages in Greek which the boys had to imitate. Finally the boys' singing ability was assessed as the Chorus chanted its lines. The performance was very successful.
